result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy A Lein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Burger King to be paid as a condition of probation and to be paid before costs or fines.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with: victims, their residence, or their place of employment.  Maintain full time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
16CM386 and 16CM460 are dismissed and read in.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

Defendant Timothy A Lein in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.   Attorney Weathers requests a sentencing date in about 45 days to allow for upfront payment and completion of treatment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on July 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Timothy A Lein in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Weathers requests additional time to make up front payment on the restitution being requested. The Court schedules 16CM120 for a jury trial and the other cases to tag along.
Plea hearing on April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Timothy A Lein did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  The Attorney advises the Court she has received discovery and an offer.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 03-14-2016 10:00 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant to have no contact with any Burger King.

Defendant Timothy A Lein in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
